alert.note: Alert for Sabine; San Augustine (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 8:41PM CST until January 26 at 8:24PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Ayish Bayou Near San Augustine affecting San Augustine and Sabine Counties. For the Ayish Bayou...including San Augustine...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ayish Bayou near San Augustine. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Lowland flooding of the heavily wooded floodplain will continue for the next several days. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CST Thursday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM CST Thursday was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 6.3 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.7 feet on 12/22/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Friday evening at 830 PM CST.
